thread.title: Migration to Memminger gala to showcase birds of prey, jazz & live auction
thread.title_full: Migration to Memminger gala to showcase birds of prey, jazz & live auction

title: Migration to Memminger gala to showcase birds of prey, jazz & live auction
text: Migration to Memminger gala to showcase birds of prey, jazz & live auction Oct 7 2015 2:28 pm Birds will be center stage at the third annual Migration to Memminger gala to benefit The Center for the Birds of Prey and the Avian Conservation Center. file/Marie Rodriguez/Special to The Post and Courier × Admirers of the natural world will flock to Memminger Auditorium this weekend for the third annual Migration to Memminger gala, a fundraiser for the Avian Conservation Center and Center for Birds of Prey. An array of live birds of prey will inhabit the auditorium for the event, as will solo jazz guitarist David Archer. There will be cocktails and hors d’oeuvres as well. The central attraction of the night will be the live auction, held digitally through Bidr.co, which will include framed art by photographer Steven Hyatt, known for his images of Charleston scenery and birds of prey; artisan creations such as hand-carved oyster knives and a reclaimed wood birdhouse; vacations to Wild Dunes and Sullivan’s Island; and many other bid-worthy items. Proceeds will help the Avian Conservation Center and Center for Birds of Prey continue avian conservation efforts in the region. Guests are encouraged to wear cocktail attire. When: 6:30-9:30 p.m. Thursday Where: 56 Beaufain St., Charleston Price: $150 More info: (843) 971-7474 or http://bidr.co/events/migration Keywords
